docs.heading: CompactAlertBanner
docs.firstParagraph: The CompactAlertBanner component is used to show the user information about something that happened in the app (f.e. loading failed), with optional actions to continue with.
tablesHtml:
NameTypeDefaultDescription
titlestringThe title of the banner
typetypeerrorThe type of the banner
actionactionAn action to let the user do something
childrenReactChildThe message inside the banner
isFloatingbooleanfalseApplies a "floating" style to the banner - to look like it's floating above content
iconReactChildIf provided, replaces the default icon in the banner
onClose() => voidIf provided, shows a close button in the corner, which should close the banner

NameTypeDescription
iconReact.ReactChild | undefinedIf provided, renders an icon along with the label.
labelstringThe label of the action button.
onClick() => voidThe callback to execute on clicking the action button.
isLoadingbooleanIf provided with truthful value, button renders spinner and it is not possible to click on it.
isDisabledbooleanIf provided with truthful value, button gets diabled and is not possible to click on it.

typeicon
"neutral"InfoCircleIcon
"success"CheckmarkCircleFilledIcon
"warning"AlertIcon
"error"RemoveCircleFilledIcon
"info"InfoCircleIcon
docs.fullText:
Healthy
CompactAlertBanner

The CompactAlertBanner component is used to show the user information about something that happened in the app (f.e. loading failed), with optional actions to continue with.

It's different from the AlertBanner component in that it takes up less space, since all of its contents are in one row. Moreover, it only provides 1 action (as opposed to 2 in the block variant).

import { CompactAlertBanner } from '@productboard/nucleus/core';
Copy

After adding the import into your file you can use it like this:

<CompactAlertBanner title="My banner">Hello world!</CompactAlertBanner>
Copy
Props

Table below contains all types of the props available in the CompactAlertBanner component.

Name	Type	Default	Description
title	string		The title of the banner
type	type	error	The type of the banner
action	action		An action to let the user do something
children	ReactChild		The message inside the banner
isFloating	boolean	false	Applies a "floating" style to the banner - to look like it's floating above content
icon	ReactChild		If provided, replaces the default icon in the banner
onClose	() => void		If provided, shows a close button in the corner, which should close the banner
Action type
Name	Type	Description
icon	React.ReactChild | undefined	If provided, renders an icon along with the label.
label	string	The label of the action button.
onClick	() => void	The callback to execute on clicking the action button.
isLoading	boolean	If provided with truthful value, button renders spinner and it is not possible to click on it.
isDisabled	boolean	If provided with truthful value, button gets diabled and is not possible to click on it.
Default icons

If the icon prop isn't provided, it defaults to a pre-defined list, based on the type:

type	icon
"neutral"	InfoCircleIcon
"success"	CheckmarkCircleFilledIcon
"warning"	AlertIcon
"error"	RemoveCircleFilledIcon
"info"	InfoCircleIcon
Health Status checklist

OPEN IN FIGMA

Follows WCAG 2.0 standards for contrast (AA).

Follows WCAG 2.0 standards for keyboard accessibility and includes a description of the keyboard interactions.
Latest implementation standards
Implementation complies with coding and API conventions for the design systems components.

It’s correctly displayed in supported screen sizes.

Design tokens

Covered by tests
All functionalities of the component are covered by unit tests.
docs.rawHtml:
Healthy

CompactAlertBanner

The CompactAlertBanner component is used to show the user information about something that happened in the app (f.e. loading failed), with optional actions to continue with.

It's different from the AlertBanner component in that it takes up less space, since all of its contents are in one row. Moreover, it only provides 1 action (as opposed to 2 in the block variant).

import { CompactAlertBanner } from '@productboard/nucleus/core';

After adding the import into your file you can use it like this:

<CompactAlertBanner title="My banner">Hello world!</CompactAlertBanner>

Props

Table below contains all types of the props available in the CompactAlertBanner component.

NameTypeDefaultDescription
titlestringThe title of the banner
typetypeerrorThe type of the banner
actionactionAn action to let the user do something
childrenReactChildThe message inside the banner
isFloatingbooleanfalseApplies a "floating" style to the banner - to look like it's floating above content
iconReactChildIf provided, replaces the default icon in the banner
onClose() => voidIf provided, shows a close button in the corner, which should close the banner

Action type

NameTypeDescription
iconReact.ReactChild | undefinedIf provided, renders an icon along with the label.
labelstringThe label of the action button.
onClick() => voidThe callback to execute on clicking the action button.
isLoadingbooleanIf provided with truthful value, button renders spinner and it is not possible to click on it.
isDisabledbooleanIf provided with truthful value, button gets diabled and is not possible to click on it.

Default icons

If the icon prop isn't provided, it defaults to a pre-defined list, based on the type:

typeicon
"neutral"InfoCircleIcon
"success"CheckmarkCircleFilledIcon
"warning"AlertIcon
"error"RemoveCircleFilledIcon
"info"InfoCircleIcon

Healthy
BadgeText

The BadgeText holds a small amount of textual information.

After adding the import into your file you can use it like this:

Props

Table below contains all types of the props available in the BadgeText component.

Name	Type	Default	Description
type	type	"neutral"	The type of the BadgeText
children	string \| () => string		The message inside the BadgeText
Types
type
"neutral"
"positive"
"premium"
"negative"
"white"
Additional guidelines

<Badge type="white" /> is supposed to be used only on non-white backgrounds.

docs.rawHtml:
Healthy

BadgeText

The BadgeText holds a small amount of textual information.

import { BadgeText } from '@productboard/nucleus/core';

After adding the import into your file you can use it like this:

<BadgeText type="positive">Hello world!</BadgeText>

Props

Table below contains all types of the props available in the BadgeText component.

NameTypeDefaultDescription
typetype"neutral"The type of the BadgeText
childrenstring \| () => stringThe message inside the BadgeText

Types

type
"neutral"
"positive"
"premium"
"negative"
"white"

Additional guidelines

<Badge type="white" /> is supposed to be used only on non-white backgrounds.

Available system props
System props allow extending component by certain properties.
Global system props
dataCy
Layout system props

Accepts any token from spacing scale.
